00055 #include <boost/cstdint.hpp> //uint32_t
00056 #include <boost/interprocess/detail/atomic.hpp> //atomic_inc32()
00057 #include <boost/thread.hpp> //yield()
00058 #include <boost/exception/exception.hpp> //exception()

00060 /*********/
00061 /* Setup */
00062 /*********/
00063 #ifdef _DEBUG
00064         // Will write to cout every push and pop operation.
00065         //#define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00066         // This will check in destructor, that the queue is empty.
00067         //#define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_SAFE_DELETE
00068 #endif
00069 // When you only use pushUnsafe(), you can disable push() to save memory.
00070 //#define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_PUSH
00071 // When you only use popUnsafe(), you can disable pop() to save memory.
00072 //#define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_POP
00073 
00074 // This is called, when the thread needs to wait
00075 #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT
00076         // yield will add CPU to other thread, but wont go sleep for fixed time.
00077         // yield is not good for long living queues.
00078         #define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT() boost::this_thread::yield()
00079         
00080         //#define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT() boost::this_thread::sleep(boost::posix_time::millisec(1))
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 // End of Setup
00084 
00085 #ifdef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00086         #include <iostream>
00087         #include <boost/interprocess/sync/interprocess_mutex.hpp>
00088         boost::interprocess::interprocess_mutex cout_mutex;
00089         #define COUT_WRITE(msg) { cout_mutex.lock(); std::cout << msg; cout_mutex.unlock();}
00090 #endif
00091 
00093 struct exNoMorePush : virtual boost::exception { };
00094 
00095 
00096 
00097 template <typename T, boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
00098 class circular_queue {
00099 public:
00100         circular_queue() :
00101                 mWritePos(0),
00102                 mReadPos(0),
00103                 mNoMorePush(false)
00104         {
00105                 for(boost::uint32_t i = 0; i < size; i++){
00106                         mHasData[i] = false;
00107                         #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_PUSH
00108                                 mPushQueue[i] = 0;
00109                                 mPushTicket[i] = 0;
00110                         #endif
00111                         #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_POP
00112                                 mPopQueue[i] = 0;
00113                                 mPopTicket[i] = 0;
00114                         #endif
00115                 }
00116 
00117                 // 0x100000000 needs to be dividable by size or it will fail on overflow.
00118                 BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT( (0xFFFFFFFFu % size) == (size - 1) );
00119         }
00120 
00121         virtual ~circular_queue(){
00122                 #ifdef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_SAFE_DELETE
00123                         bool hasData = false;
00124                         for(boost::uint32_t i = 0; i < size; i++){
00125                                 hasData |= mHasData[i];
00126                         }
00127                         //asserts, when you delete a non-empty queue.
00128                         //you can disable this assert by defining CIRCULAR_QUEUE_SAFE_DELETE
00129                         BOOST_ASSERT(!hasData)
00130                 #endif
00131         }
00132         
00139         void pushUnsafe(const T &item){
00140                 BOOST_ASSERT(!mNoMorePush);
00141                 boost::uint32_t mypos = mWritePos;
00142                 mWritePos++;
00143                 
00144                 #ifdef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00145                         COUT_WRITE("push " << mypos << std::endl);
00146                 #endif
00147                 mypos %= size;
00148 
00149                 //queue is full, wait for workers.
00150                 while(mHasData[mypos] != false){
00151                         CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT();
00152                 }
00153 
00154                 mData[mypos] = item;
00155                 mHasData[mypos] = true;
00156         }
00157 #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_PUSH
00158 
00164         void push(const T &item){
00165                 BOOST_ASSERT(!mNoMorePush);
00166                 boost::uint32_t mypos = boost::interprocess::detail::atomic_inc32(&mWritePos);
00167                 
00168                 #ifdef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00169                         COUT_WRITE("push " << mypos << std::endl);
00170                 #endif
00171                 mypos %= size;
00172                 
00173                 boost::uint32_t ticket = boost::interprocess::detail::atomic_inc32(&mPushQueue[mypos]);
00174 
00175                 //another thread is pushing on the same queue item.
00176                 //happens, when a thread is doing a push() and the cpu is switched to other thread, which pushes 32 items, before the other thread can do the push.
00177                 //this is rare situation, you should increase size for speed-up, when this happens.
00178                 while(ticket != mPushTicket[mypos]){
00179                         CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT();
00180                 }
00181 
00182                 //queue is full, wait for workers.
00183                 while(mHasData[mypos]){
00184                         CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT();
00185                 }
00186 
00187                 mData[mypos] = item;
00188                 mHasData[mypos] = true;
00189                 mPushTicket[mypos]++;
00190         }
00191 #endif //CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_PUSH
00192 #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_POP
00193 
00200         bool pop(T &item){
00201                 boost::uint32_t mypos = boost::interprocess::detail::atomic_inc32(&mReadPos);
00202                 #ifdef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00203                 COUT_WRITE("pop " << mypos << std::endl);
00204                 #endif
00205                 mypos %= size;
00206                 
00207                 boost::uint32_t ticket = boost::interprocess::detail::atomic_inc32(&mPopQueue[mypos]);
00208 
00209                 //another thread is popping on the same queue item.
00210                 //this is rare situation, you should increase size for speed-up, when this happens.
00211                 while(ticket != mPopTicket[mypos]){
00212                         if(mNoMorePush)
00213                                 return false;
00214                         CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT();
00215                 }
00216 
00217                 //queue is empty, wait for data.
00218                 while(!mHasData[mypos]){
00219                         if(mNoMorePush)
00220                                 return false;
00221                         CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT();
00222                 }
00223                 
00224                 item = mData[mypos];
00225                 mHasData[mypos] = false;
00226                 mPopTicket[mypos]++;
00227                 return true;
00228         }
00229 
00237         T pop(){
00238                 T data;
00239                 if(pop(data))
00240                         return data;
00241                 else
00242                         throw exNoMorePush();
00243         }
00244 #endif //CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_POP
00245 
00253         bool popUnsafe(T &item){
00254                 boost::uint32_t mypos = mReadPos;
00255                 mReadPos++;
00256                 #ifdef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00257                         COUT_WRITE("pop " << mypos << std::endl);
00258                 #endif
00259                 mypos %= size;
00260 
00261                 //queue is empty, wait for data.
00262                 while(!mHasData[mypos]){
00263                         if(mNoMorePush)
00264                                 return false;
00265                         CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT();
00266                 }
00267                 
00268                 item = mData[mypos];
00269                 mHasData[mypos] = false;
00270                 return true;
00271         }
00279         T popUnsafe(){
00280                 T data;
00281                 if(popUnsafe(data))
00282                         return data;
00283                 else
00284                         throw exNoMorePush();
00285         }
00291         void signalNoMorePush(){
00292                 mNoMorePush = true;
00293         }
00300         int getQueueLength(){
00301                 return (int)(mWritePos - mReadPos);
00302         }
00303 private:
00304         /* Contains the queue items.
00305          * Setting mData to volatile will disable some optimizations in T class.
00306          * All compilers (what I've tested) will set mData before mHasData,
00307          * so it should be safe without volatile.
00308          */
00309         /* volatile */ T mData[size]; // queue items
00310         volatile bool mHasData[size]; // signal between push and pop threads
00311         volatile boost::uint32_t mWritePos; // push position
00312         volatile boost::uint32_t mReadPos; //pop position
00313         volatile bool mNoMorePush; //
00314 
00315 #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_PUSH
00316         //ticket system works like a lock, but faster.
00317         //when a thread want to push:
00318         //      1. thread gets a ticket
00319         //      2. waits for threads ticket in mPushTicket
00320         //      3. waits for worker to process prev ticket.
00321         //      3. pushes data
00322         //      4. increases mPushTicket
00323         volatile boost::uint32_t mPushQueue[size]; //get push ticket here
00324         volatile boost::uint32_t mPushTicket[size]; //current active push ticket
00325 #endif
00326 #ifndef CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_POP
00327         volatile boost::uint32_t mPopQueue[size]; //get push ticket here
00328         volatile boost::uint32_t mPopTicket[size]; //current active push ticket
00329 #endif
00330 };
00331

00335         #define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_VERBOSE
00336         
00338         #define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_SAFE_DELETE
00339         
00341         #define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_PUSH
00342         
00344         #define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_DISABLE_SAFE_POP
00345         
00347         #define CIRCULAR_QUEUE_WAIT()
00348 #endif
00349 
00350 #endif //CIRCULAR_QUEUE_H
